user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_fallback_:
```c
static int
mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_fallback_ (void)
{
  int ret = -1;
#if defined(HAVE_SYSCONF) && \
  (defined(HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU) || defined(HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF))
  long value = -1;
#ifdef HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU
  if (0 >= value)
    value = sysconf (_SC_CRAY_NCPU);
#endif /* HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU */
#ifdef HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF
  if (0 >= value)
    value = sysconf (_SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF);
#endif /* HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF */
  if (0 >= value)
    return -1;
  ret = (int) value;
  if ((long) ret != value)
    return -1; /* Overflow */
#endif /* HAVE_SYSCONF &&
          (HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU || HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF) */
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#if defined(HAVE_SYSCONF) && \
  (defined(HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU) || defined(HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF))
  long value = -1;
#ifdef HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU
  if (0 >= value)
    value = sysconf (_SC_CRAY_NCPU);
#endif /* HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU */
#ifdef HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF
  if (0 >= value)
    value = sysconf (_SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF);
#endif /* HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF */
  if (0 >= value)
    return -1;
  ret = (int) value;
  if ((long) ret != value)
    return -1; /* Overflow */
#endif /* HAVE_SYSCONF &&
          (HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU || HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF) */
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The fragment is compiled only when HAVE_SYSCONF and at least one of HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU or HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF is defined; in that configuration all statements can be reached at runtime (the first sysconf call is reached when HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU is defined, the second when only or still-needed HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF is defined, and the subsequent checks/returns are reachable depending on sysconf results). If the macros are not defined the block is removed by the preprocessor (not ‘‘unreachable’’ code present in the build).
